greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, A097806 * A127647, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: A097806 * A127647 as infinite lower triangular matrices.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: Table[If[k==n, Fibonacci[n+1], If[k==n-1, Fibonacci[n], 0]], {n, 0, 15}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 11 2019 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = if(k==n, fibonacci(n+1), if(k==n-1, fibonacci(n), 0)); \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 11 2019
(MAGMA) [k eq n select Fibonacci(n+1) else k eq n-1 select Fibonacci(n) else 0: k in [0..n], n in [0..15]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 11 2019
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..15)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 11 2019
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 10 2007
ext: More terms added by _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 11 2019
